website_summaries.verdict: An economical way to introduce toddlers to skiing with skis, poles, and bindings included.
pros: No waxing needed for these plastic, low-resistance skis
Most kids 4 and under can use easily
2-button quick-release bindings make unstrapping the skis from snow boots much easier
cons: Plastic can crack if kids are too large to use them, so parents with kids older than 4 should look for junior-sized downhill skis

customer_reviews.title: perfect first skis
customer_reviews.text: My granddaughter (2 1/2 years old) is using these and they are perfect for her use. Her boots fit nicely in the straps and they even have a quick release, so we don't have to readjust the straps each time. The poles are a perfect length and are not sharp or dangerous for little kids. They have a blunt tip and soft plastic wings on the ends.
customer_reviews.author: otis

customer_reviews.title: Love these skis!
customer_reviews.text: We finally got enough snow to use these and my daughter loves them! She just turned two and they are a great fit and will likely fit well all next winter as well. Love that her regular snow boots fit on them so I don’t have to buy another set of boots. They are very slippery on the bottom as they don’t have any kind of traction but she did surprisingly well and only fell once or twice.
customer_reviews.author: HappyMommy

customer_reviews.title: Perfect !!
customer_reviews.text: Very pleased with the great looking and durable skis!! And also very pleased with the fantastic service !!! Completely satisfied !!
customer_reviews.author: Killer

customer_reviews.title: Gave as a gift
customer_reviews.text: I gave this as a gift at a baby shower so I can't tell if it works well or not, but I received it with no problems.
customer_reviews.author: Mary F. Glover

customer_reviews.title: not for skiing.
customer_reviews.text: These are like Cross country skis. Heels lift. Only attached at the toe. If your kid leans forward at all, they'll fall. Don't buy if you intend for them to actually learn to ski. This will probably delay their learning. Not even good for walking around. I opted for some cheap used real skis and boots. Cost $99, but will last much longer. These are only good for posing for photos, not skiing. The video is of my 22 month old on the regular skis. Let's see some videos of kids skiing on these poorly made plastic things.
customer_reviews.author: JR

customer_reviews.title: Very Nice
customer_reviews.text: They fit our 2 year old well, right over her boots and she was able to take off on them right away. Fun for backyard play.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Very cute / quality
customer_reviews.text: Very cute products, my Little one is 21 months now, He tried his first ski by using this. Thank you .
customer_reviews.author: J GH

customer_reviews.title: Basic Baby Skis
customer_reviews.text: The value is great. They are a simple set of skis that will allow a little one to learn the movement of skiing. They will not be anything technical but they will be a fun backyard toy.
customer_reviews.author: MJSB

customer_reviews.title: Great toddler skis
customer_reviews.text: So far so good, I have my soon to be 2 yr old on these skis! I love how easy it is that he can just wear his own snow boots!
customer_reviews.author: Lisa Coate

customer_reviews.title: Great lightweight ski set
customer_reviews.text: I used these as part of my Christmas decoration display. This set is a great addition.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great to get kids comfortable with skiing
customer_reviews.text: We bought 2 pairs for my 2 year old son and my niece as we were keen to get them used to skies early. This was the perfect solution. It allowed us to warm the kids up to the idea of skiing without costing a fortune and they will work for a couple years while they practice getting used to the slope. No need for rental of boots, skies and poles each time we hit the slopes which is you go a couple times a year adds up! Very happy with our purchase and the price.
customer_reviews.author: Caroline H

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for little begginers
customer_reviews.text: My daughter loves them and they are perfect for little beginners.
customer_reviews.author: Emilia

customer_reviews.title: They fit nice & was able to use them the same day ...
customer_reviews.text: They fit nice & was able to use them the same day he received them. He learned to glide without the poles in the beginning, & now is learning to use the poles a little at a time.
customer_reviews.author: Sidney Lokken

customer_reviews.title: You get what you pay for
customer_reviews.text: The product came and was delivered as described. This starter set is a good set for my 2 year old beginner. Unfortunately one of the plastic clips broke prior to using the skis. We were on the ski slopes and ran back to the hut to get a few pieces of duct tape as a temporary fix so we could still enjoy our time after the drive to the ski resort. We paid a great price for these skis and unfortunately this is what you get.
customer_reviews.author: NGoode

customer_reviews.title: My Daughter loves them!!
customer_reviews.text: Adjustable bindings make these perfect for my 18mo daughter. Will be great for the next couple of seasons.
customer_reviews.author: Mark

customer_reviews.title: Flimsy
customer_reviews.text: These are not stable. Felt flimsy and didn't feel like it was sturdy or safe
customer_reviews.author: Dorota E. Kopacz

customer_reviews.title: Haven’t tried yet, but like the look and seem sturdy
customer_reviews.text: I give them five stars because they arrived fine in the box and look like fine quality for my 3 year old. It hadn’t snowed yet when they arrived, so were unable to test them, but I will adjust my review if we have any problems. The Christmas design with the reindeer on them is super cute.
customer_reviews.author: Jessica

customer_reviews.title: Great fun
customer_reviews.text: My 2 year old Grandson is a little young for these skies but we held his hand and he had a ball!! We purchased a helmet and he cross country skied!! Great fun.
customer_reviews.author: Deborah C.

customer_reviews.title: Great little skis
customer_reviews.text: The skis are adorable, appear durable and my 3 year old daughter loves the design. They have ‘fish scales’ to achieve grip so no waxing. I was surprised at the quality of material the poles are made of....albeit we don’t plan on using them. Looking forward to short cross country skiing trips with the 3 year old now in tow...not on a sled where she gets freezing cold and bored from sitting still!
customer_reviews.author: Vicki Lewis

customer_reviews.title: Great for little kids
customer_reviews.text: Love these skis for my 3 year old. They fit his boots well and are great for training. He’s not like a pro at skiing but these allow him to learn the basics.
customer_reviews.author: Kelsey37

customer_reviews.title: Great skis for a young child to learn with
customer_reviews.text: Gave as a gift for my 3 1/2 year old nephew. He loves them! They are easy for him to put on by himself.
customer_reviews.author: Jessica

customer_reviews.title: Great
customer_reviews.text: My daughter loves this. Excited to give skiing a go this winter
customer_reviews.author: james lee

customer_reviews.title: Quality seemed good
customer_reviews.text: The product was too small for my grandson. Nice quality for a beginner
customer_reviews.author: Funskrmom

customer_reviews.title: Too flimsy
customer_reviews.text: Too small and flimsy for a robust 3 year old. Will be returning this product.
customer_reviews.author: Helen Lawson

customer_reviews.title: Pop quality of straps and doesn’t fit ski boots
customer_reviews.text: As soon as I tight the strap it broke and her snow boot didn’t fit as described . Your child would have a regular rainboot not ski boot to fit
customer_reviews.author: ELIZABETH SERRATO

customer_reviews.title: Unsafe, there isn’t anything that prevents side sliding. ...
customer_reviews.text: Unsafe, there isn’t anything that prevents side sliding. My son side slipped and twisted his leg. I wish I could return it
customer_reviews.author: archi

customer_reviews.title: Nice set for toddler
customer_reviews.text: Purchased this to give as a gift to my 2 year old for the holidays. We haven't had a chance to try them out yet, but they look great!
customer_reviews.author: Michael Komm

customer_reviews.title: Perfect first set of skis
customer_reviews.text: Adorable and reliable for teaching our 2.5 how to ski!
customer_reviews.author: Sean F.

customer_reviews.title: Poor quality
customer_reviews.text: When the item arrived the ends of the ski poles were warped and one of them had a broken piece. Disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Rachel

customer_reviews.title: Great kids skis
customer_reviews.text: My son loved his skiing adventure. Perfect fit and easy to get boots into.
customer_reviews.author: DeNell Garceau

customer_reviews.title: Toddler loves it
customer_reviews.text: Our daughter did well on the snow with skis, but she also walks around the house with skis and poles!
customer_reviews.author: Svetlana Johnson

customer_reviews.title: Loose straps, but otherwise great
customer_reviews.text: These are great for the price but the straps the use have to be tightened regularly which is an annoyance.
customer_reviews.author: Joshua

customer_reviews.title: Good toddler starter skis
customer_reviews.text: Very good skis for toddler just learning to balance and slide. Bindings fit well to any toddler boot or shoe.
customer_reviews.author: Richard Knight

customer_reviews.title: Less then expected
customer_reviews.text: Strap broke first time putting them in my 3 year old
customer_reviews.author: Robin Smith

customer_reviews.title: A gift. Not aware if it has been used yet.
customer_reviews.text: Gift. You should allow for this so not required to give bogus rankings
customer_reviews.author: Larry F.

customer_reviews.title: Affordable
customer_reviews.text: These skis were exactly what we were looking for! Great price and quality!
customer_reviews.author: Gretchen Kimball

customer_reviews.title: Great introduction
customer_reviews.text: Our little man is obsessed with these. He is just less than 2 years old and won't take them off. They are a great introduction.
customer_reviews.author: Angela

customer_reviews.title: so far so good
customer_reviews.text: Skis arrived as expected and seem to work good. Poles are extremely heavy for the size but not a deal breaker.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: I use them outside my door for decoration
customer_reviews.text: the product was fine i just use them for decoration
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Don’t buy.
customer_reviews.text: Absolute piece of junk. Binding broke in the first minute.
customer_reviews.author: E. D. Couchon

customer_reviews.title: So cute and functional too!
customer_reviews.text: Our two year old kept putting these on even before we left the house to drive to the snow! We tested them out one day so far and they are just perfect for beginners. She can wear her regular boots for cold weather and we clip her in!
customer_reviews.author: Jess

customer_reviews.title: Good purchase even if they’re not used for long.
customer_reviews.text: Works as expected. Bindings needed to be tightened to skis. We have a “real” pair of toddler ski boots that fit into the strap bindings of these skis. Our 2yr boy seems to be more successful this way than his snow boots. Don’t know if they’ll let us on the lift with them but skis with releasable bindings are too heavy for him at this age. Even if he graduates quickly from these skis, I’m glad to have purchased them.
customer_reviews.author: Bruce

customer_reviews.title: Worth what you pay
customer_reviews.text: These are the perfect skis for a toddler to be learning the ropes of skiing. They can wear their own boots, their the perfect length and thickness. They even have the fish scale tread on bottom.
customer_reviews.author: Nicholas M.

customer_reviews.title: Great beginner ski
customer_reviews.text: My little just got their first storm and were so excited to try them out! They were great!! Super fun, colorful design!
customer_reviews.author: Deidre McCarty

customer_reviews.title: Fun on the slopes for the little ones!
customer_reviews.text: Great little skies for young children! Fun on the slopes!!
customer_reviews.author: Matthew P Fox

customer_reviews.title: Perfect fit as described
customer_reviews.text: Haven’t used it yet but they fit perfect on the try on
customer_reviews.author: Roeun chan

customer_reviews.title: Son Loves His Skis
customer_reviews.text: My son loves his skis, we can drag him on the carpet of our house when there is not enough snow outside.
customer_reviews.author: Mom of 3

product_meta.title: Odoland Kid's Beginner Snow Skis and Poles, Low-Resistant Ski Boards for Age 4 and Under, Lightweight, Sturdy and Safe
feature_bullets: Ideal for Kids Age 4 or Below: This snowflake ski boards with poles is ideal for kids to use. Lightweight plastic material with no metal edges, round tips and rugged design are safe for your kids (age 4 and under) to enjoy skiing early.

Easy for Learning: This set has double snowflake skis with poles, which is a perfect introductory set for ski learners, especially for kids. Unlike snowboard, it is easy to learn and enjoy in the snow world.

Unique Boards with Low-Resistant Design: To get a better skiing experience like an agile swallow, the front end of these skis are a little lifted. Unlike flat design, it greatly reduces resistance while skiing.
Safe for Young Skiers: Plastic skis with no metal edges and round tips make these the ideal first pair of skis for kids.

Lightweight & Sturdy: Made of high quality PE material, this set is lightweight for kids. Tests show that it can withstand -4 Fahrenheit degree. With durable fixing structure, it’s long-lasting to use even in an extremely cold environment.
